A.phrase: I saw [a] cat in the garden.

description.definition: Used before a noun to denote one item or instance of something.
description.example: She wants to buy a new car.

description.definition: On the subject of; concerning.
description.example: He asked about my weekend plans.

description.definition: At a higher level or layer than.
description.example: There is a ceiling fan above the table.

description.definition: From one side to the other of something.
description.simplified: Going from one side to another.
description.example: They built a bridge across the river.

A.phrase: He will [act] in the school play.

description.definition: To perform a role or function.
description.example: She acts responsibly in difficult situations.

A.phrase: He is an [active] member of the club.

description.definition: Engaging in energetic or physical movement.
description.example: He leads an active lifestyle by jogging every morning.

description.definition: A thing that a person or group does or has done.
description.example: Reading is her favorite activity.

A.phrase: Please [add] more sugar to the tea.

description.definition: To join or combine something with another.
description.example: Can you add my name to the list?

description.definition: Feeling fear or anxiety.
description.example: He’s afraid of the dark.

description.definition: In the time following an event or period.
description.example: We can go to the park after school.

description.definition: Another time; once more.
description.example: She asked me to call her again tomorrow.

description.definition: The length of time that a person or thing has existed.
description.example: Her age is 25 years old.

description.definition: Before the present; earlier.
description.example: She moved here a long time ago.

description.definition: To have the same opinion or belief as another.
description.example: They agree on the terms of the contract.

description.definition: The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture of oxygen and nitrogen.
description.example: The air is cool and crisp in the mountains.

description.definition: The whole quantity or extent of something.
description.example: All of my friends are going to the party.

A.phrase: He felt [alone] in the big house.

description.definition: Having no one else present; on one's own.
description.example: She prefers to be alone when she reads.

description.definition: Moving in a constant direction on a line, path, or course.
description.example: We drove along the coast.

description.definition: Before the time in question; by now or before now.
description.example: She already knew the answer.

A.phrase: She [always] brings her lunch to work.

description.definition: At all times; on every occasion.
description.example: He always forgets his keys.

description.definition: The first-person singular present tense of the verb 'to be'.
description.example: I am happy with the results.

A.phrase: What [amount] of sugar do we need?

description.definition: A quantity of something, especially the total of a thing or things in number, size, or value.
description.example: The amount of water in the bottle is two liters.

description.definition: Used before words beginning with a vowel sound, indicating a single item or example.
description.simplified: One of something, used before a vowel sound.
description.example: He saw an eagle flying above.

description.definition: Used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing items in a list or series.
description.example: We are going to the park and the library.

A.phrase: He was [angry] after missing the bus.

description.definition: Feeling or showing strong annoyance or hostility.
description.example: She was angry when she heard the news.

A.phrase: She asked for [another] cup of coffee.

description.definition: An additional one of the same kind; one more.
description.example: Would you like another slice of cake?

description.definition: To respond to a question or statement.
description.example: He didn't know how to answer the riddle.

description.definition: Used to refer to one or some of a thing, no matter how much or many.
description.simplified: One or some, no specific amount.
description.example: You can take any of the books.

description.definition: Any person at all, no matter who.
description.example: Anyone can join the club.

description.definition: Used to refer to a thing, no matter what.
description.example: You can ask me anything.

description.definition: At whatever time; whenever.
description.example: Feel free to call anytime.

description.definition: To come into sight; become visible.
description.example: A rainbow appeared after the rain.

description.definition: A round fruit with red, green, or yellow skin and a crisp, sweet flesh.
description.example: He picked an apple from the tree.

description.definition: The present tense plural and second person singular form of 'to be'.
description.example: They are going to the park.

A.phrase: This [area] is perfect for a picnic.

description.definition: A region or part of a space, often defined by boundaries.
description.simplified: A place or part of a space.
description.example: The parking area is full.

description.definition: Each of the two upper limbs of the human body, extending from the shoulder to the hand.
description.example: He broke his arm during the game.

description.definition: An organized military force equipped for fighting on land.
description.example: The army was deployed to assist in the emergency.

description.definition: On every side of something.
description.example: He ran around the park.

description.definition: To reach a destination.
description.example: We should arrive at the airport early.

description.definition: The expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form.
description.simplified: Creative work like painting or drawing.
description.example: His art is displayed in the museum.

description.definition: Used to indicate the function or role of someone or something.
description.example: He is known as a great leader.

A.phrase: I want to [ask] you a question.

description.definition: To say something in order to obtain an answer or information.
description.example: She asked if I could help her move.

description.definition: Expressing the location or position of something.
description.example: She is waiting at the bus stop.

A.phrase: The army planned to [attack] at dawn.

description.definition: To take aggressive action against a person or place.
description.simplified: To fight against someone or something.
description.example: The lion will attack its prey.

description.definition: The sister of one's father or mother or the wife of one's uncle.
description.example: My aunt is coming to the family reunion.

description.definition: The season after summer and before winter, characterized by cooler weather and falling leaves.
description.simplified: The season between summer and winter.
description.example: Autumn is her favorite time of year.

description.definition: To or at a distance from a particular place, person, or thing.
description.simplified: Not here; in a different place.
description.example: The ship sailed away from the shore.

description.definition: A very young child or infant.
description.example: The baby cried loudly.

B.phrase: The [base] of the statue was strong.

description.definition: The lowest part or bottom of something.
description.example: The base of the mountain is wide.

B.phrase: He turned his [back] to the audience.

description.definition: The rear part of the human body from the neck to the base of the spine.
description.simplified: The rear part of the body.
description.example: She hurt her back while lifting.

description.definition: Not good; unpleasant or of poor quality.
description.example: He had a bad day.

B.phrase: She put her books in the [bag].

description.definition: A flexible container with an opening at the top, used for carrying things.
description.simplified: A container used to carry things.
description.example: She bought a new bag.

B.phrase: They played with a [ball] in the park.

description.definition: A round object used in games and sports.
description.example: The ball rolled away.

description.definition: A financial institution that holds money for people.
description.simplified: A place that keeps and lends money.
description.example: He went to the bank to withdraw cash.

description.definition: A container made of interwoven material, used for carrying or holding things.
description.example: The basket was full of apples.

description.definition: An act of washing the body in water.
description.example: He enjoys taking a bath every night.

description.definition: To exist; to occur; to take place.
description.example: He will be here soon.

description.definition: A seed of a climbing plant used as food.
description.example: Green beans are healthy.

description.definition: A large, heavy mammal with thick fur and a short tail.
description.example: The bear caught a fish.

description.definition: Pleasing to the senses or mind aesthetically.
description.example: She has a beautiful smile.

B.phrase: He ordered a [beer] at the bar.

description.definition: An alcoholic drink made from yeast-fermented malt flavored with hops.
description.simplified: A drink made from malt and hops.
description.example: He drank a glass of beer.

B.phrase: She lay down on the [bed] to rest.

description.definition: A piece of furniture for sleep or rest, typically a framework with a mattress.
description.example: The bed was very comfortable.

description.definition: A room in a house where you sleep.
description.example: The bedroom has a large window.

B.phrase: The children were asked to [behave] during the trip.

description.definition: To act in a particular way, especially to be good.
description.simplified: To act in a proper way.
description.example: Please behave in class.

description.definition: Earlier than something else in time.
description.example: He came home before dinner.

description.definition: To start doing something.
description.example: Class will begin soon.

description.definition: At the back of something.
description.example: He stood behind her.

description.definition: A hollow object, typically of metal, that makes a ringing sound when struck.
description.simplified: An object that makes a ringing sound.
description.example: The school bell rang.

description.definition: At a lower level or layer.
description.example: The temperature dropped below zero.

B.phrase: [Besides] being a student, he also works part-time.

description.definition: In addition to.
description.example: She likes pizza besides pasta.

B.phrase: She is the [best] player on the team.

description.definition: Of the highest quality; most excellent.
description.example: This is the best book I have read.

description.definition: Of a more excellent or effective type or quality.
description.example: The weather is better today.

description.definition: At, into, or across the space separating two objects or regions.
description.simplified: In the middle of two things.
description.example: He stood between the trees.

description.definition: Of considerable size, extent, or intensity.
description.example: She has a big smile.

description.definition: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate distinguished by feathers, wings, and a beak.
description.simplified: An animal with feathers and wings.
description.example: The bird sang beautifully.

B.phrase: The [birth] of her baby was a joyful event.

description.definition: The emergence of a baby or young from the body of its mother.
description.example: They celebrated the birth of their child.

B.phrase: She got a gift for her [birthday].

description.definition: The anniversary of the day on which a person was born.
description.example: Her birthday is tomorrow.

B.phrase: Can I have a [bit] of chocolate?

description.definition: A small piece, part, or quantity.
description.example: She ate a bit of cake.

B.phrase: The dog might [bite] if you get too close.

description.definition: To use teeth to cut into something.
description.example: He took a bite of the apple.

description.definition: Of the very darkest color due to the absence of or complete absorption of light.
description.example: The night sky was black.

B.phrase: He cut his finger and started to [bleed].

description.definition: To lose blood from the body as a result of injury or illness.
description.example: Her knee was bleeding.

B.phrase: There is a [block] of ice in the freezer.

description.definition: A large solid piece of hard material, especially rock, stone, or wood, typically with flat surfaces on each side.
description.example: He used a block of wood.

description.definition: The red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and other vertebrate animals, carrying oxygen to and carbon dioxide from the tissues of the body.
description.simplified: The red liquid in the body.
description.example: Blood is essential for life.

description.definition: To move creating an air current.
description.example: The breeze blew gently.

description.definition: Of the color between green and violet in the spectrum, resembling the clear sky in daylight.
description.example: She painted the room blue.

B.phrase: She pinned the paper to the [board].

description.definition: A thin, flat piece of material, such as wood or plastic, often used for a specific purpose.
description.example: The board was painted white.

description.definition: A small vessel for traveling on water.
description.example: The boat sailed away.

description.definition: The physical structure of a person or an animal, including the bones, flesh, and organs.
description.simplified: The physical structure of a person or animal.
description.example: His body was tired after the run.

B.phrase: The water will [boil] in a few minutes.

description.definition: To heat a liquid until it bubbles and turns to vapor.
description.simplified: To heat liquid until it bubbles.
description.example: Boil the pasta for ten minutes.

B.phrase: He broke a [bone] in his arm.

description.definition: A rigid organ that constitutes part of the vertebrate skeleton.
description.simplified: A hard part of the skeleton.
description.example: Bones help support the body.

description.definition: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.
description.simplified: A collection of pages with text.
description.example: The book was very interesting.

description.definition: A line separating two countries, administrative divisions, or other areas.
description.simplified: The dividing line between two areas.
description.example: The border was heavily guarded.

description.definition: Brought into life; the past participle of 'bear.'
description.example: He was born in 2001.

description.definition: To take and use something belonging to someone else with the intention of returning it.
description.simplified: To use something that is not yours temporarily.
description.example: She borrowed a book from the library.

B.phrase: [Both] of them are coming to the party.

description.definition: Used to refer to two people or things together.
description.example: Both cars are fast.

description.definition: A container with a narrow neck, used for storing drinks or other liquids.
description.example: She filled the bottle with juice.

B.phrase: The book fell to the [bottom] of the shelf.

description.definition: The lowest part of something.
description.example: He dived to the bottom of the pool.

description.definition: A round, deep dish used for holding food or liquid.
description.example: The bowl was full of cereal.

B.phrase: She packed the gift in a [box].

description.definition: A container with flat sides, typically square or rectangular.
description.example: The box was full of toys.

description.definition: A male child or young man.
description.example: The boy was playing outside.

description.definition: A part of a tree that grows out from the trunk or from a bough.
description.example: The bird perched on a branch.

B.phrase: He was [brave] in the face of danger.

description.definition: Ready to face and endure danger or pain; showing courage.
description.example: The firefighter was brave.

description.definition: A food made of flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked.
description.simplified: A baked food made from flour.
description.example: He spread butter on the bread.

B.phrase: He tried not to [break] the vase.

description.definition: To separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.
description.example: She broke her phone.

description.definition: The first meal of the day, usually eaten in the morning.
description.example: He skipped breakfast today.

description.definition: To take air into the lungs and expel it.
description.example: She breathed in the fresh air.

B.phrase: They crossed the [bridge] over the river.

description.definition: A structure carrying a road, path, railroad, or canal across a river, ravine, road, or other obstacle.
description.simplified: A structure built over something to connect two places.
description.example: The bridge was old but sturdy.

description.definition: Giving out or reflecting a lot of light; shining.
description.example: The room was bright and cheerful.

B.phrase: Can you [bring] your book to class?

description.definition: To take or go with someone or something to a place.
description.simplified: To carry something to another place.
description.example: She brought her friend to the party.

description.definition: A male sibling.
description.example: His brother is very tall.

description.definition: Of a color produced by mixing red, yellow, and blue, as of dark wood or rich soil.
description.example: The leaves turned brown in autumn.

B.phrase: He used a [brush] to paint the wall.

description.definition: An implement with bristles, wire, or other filaments, used for cleaning, grooming, painting, or scrubbing.
description.simplified: A tool with bristles for cleaning or painting.
description.example: She brushed her hair.

B.phrase: They plan to [build] a new house.

description.definition: To construct something by putting parts or materials together.
description.example: The workers are building a bridge.

description.definition: To be on fire; to damage or destroy by fire.
description.simplified: To be on fire or cause fire damage.
description.example: The wood burned quickly.

description.definition: The practice of making one's living by engaging in commerce.
description.simplified: Work related to trade or services.
description.example: He started his own business.

description.definition: A large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically one serving the public on a fixed route and schedule.
description.simplified: A large vehicle for transporting people.
description.example: The bus was crowded today.

B.phrase: She was too [busy] to answer the phone.

description.definition: Having a great deal to do.
description.example: He is busy with work.

B.phrase: She wanted to go, [but] she was too tired.

description.definition: Used to introduce something contrasting with what has already been mentioned.
description.example: I like the dress, but it's too expensive.

description.definition: To obtain something in exchange for payment.
description.simplified: To get something by paying money.
description.example: He bought a new car.

B.phrase: She passed [by] the store on her way home.

description.definition: Identifying the agent performing an action; near or next to.
description.simplified: Near or done by someone or something.
description.example: The book was written by her.

C.phrase: She baked a chocolate [cake] for his birthday.

description.definition: A sweet baked food made from flour, sugar, and other ingredients.
description.example: The cake was delicious.

C.phrase: She will [call] him later.

description.definition: To cry out a name or speak in a loud voice; to contact by telephone.
description.example: He called his friend on the phone.

C.phrase: I [can] help you with that.

description.definition: Be able to; have the ability, power, or skill to.
description.example: She can speak three languages.

C.phrase: She lit a [candle] during the power outage.

description.definition: A cylinder or block of wax with a central wick that is lit to produce light as it burns.
description.simplified: A wax stick that burns for light.
description.example: The candle flickered softly.

C.phrase: He wore a baseball [cap].

description.definition: A soft, flat hat with a visor.
description.simplified: A type of hat with a front brim.
description.example: The cap protected him from the sun.

C.phrase: They drove a red [car] to the city.

description.definition: A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an engine.
description.example: The car is parked outside.

C.phrase: She sent him a birthday [card].

description.definition: A piece of thick, stiff paper or thin pasteboard, in particular one used for writing or printing on.
description.simplified: A small piece of stiff paper.
description.example: He gave her a greeting card.

C.phrase: She takes good [care] of her garden.

description.definition: The provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something.
description.simplified: Attention and effort to help or protect.
description.example: He shows great care for his pets.

C.phrase: Be [careful] with the glass!

description.definition: Making sure of avoiding potential danger, mishap, or harm; cautious.
description.example: She is always careful when crossing the road.

C.phrase: He made a [careless] mistake.

description.definition: Not giving sufficient attention or thought to avoiding harm or errors.
description.example: She was careless with her belongings.

C.phrase: She will [carry] the bags for you.

description.definition: To support and move someone or something from one place to another.
description.simplified: To move something from one place to another.
description.example: He carried the heavy box.

C.phrase: She put her glasses in a [case].

description.definition: A container designed to hold or protect something.
description.simplified: A container for keeping things safe.
description.example: The phone case protects it from damage.

C.phrase: The [cat] is sleeping on the sofa.

description.definition: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur.
description.example: The cat chased the mouse.

C.phrase: He tried to [catch] the ball.

description.definition: To capture or seize something that is moving.
description.example: She caught the bus just in time.

C.phrase: The park is located in the [central] part of the city.

description.definition: Of, at, or forming the center.
description.example: The central area of the town is busy.

C.phrase: The building is over a [century] old.

description.definition: A period of one hundred years.
description.example: She studied 20th-century history.

C.phrase: She is [certain] that she locked the door.

description.definition: Known for sure; established beyond doubt.
description.example: He is certain he left it here.

C.phrase: He sat on the wooden [chair].

description.definition: A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.
description.example: The chair was very comfortable.

C.phrase: This is your [chance] to win the game.

description.definition: A possibility of something happening.
description.example: Don’t miss this chance.

C.phrase: She wants to [change] her hairstyle.

description.definition: To make or become different.
description.example: He changed his clothes.

C.phrase: The dog will [chase] the ball.

description.definition: To pursue in order to catch or catch up with.
description.example: The cat chased the mouse.

C.phrase: These shoes were very [cheap].

description.definition: Low in price, especially in relation to similar items.
description.example: The food was cheap but tasty.

C.phrase: She loves eating [cheese] with crackers.

description.definition: A dairy product made from curdled or cultured milk.
description.example: The cheese was very creamy.

C.phrase: They cooked [chicken] for dinner.

description.definition: A domesticated bird kept for its eggs or meat.
description.simplified: A bird often eaten as food.
description.example: She roasted the chicken.

C.phrase: The [child] is playing with a toy.

description.definition: A young human being below the age of puberty.
description.example: The child is happy.

C.phrase: The [children] are in the playground.

description.definition: Plural of child; young humans.
description.example: The children are playing.

C.phrase: She loves [chocolate] ice cream.

description.definition: A food preparation in the form of a paste or solid block made from roasted and ground cacao seeds.
description.simplified: A sweet treat made from cocoa.
description.example: The chocolate melted in the heat.

C.phrase: You have a [choice] between tea and coffee.

description.definition: An act of selecting or making a decision when faced with two or more possibilities.
description.example: She made a good choice.

C.phrase: He needs to [choose] the right answer.

description.definition: To pick out or select from a number of alternatives.
description.example: She chose the red dress.

C.phrase: They sat in a [circle] around the campfire.

description.definition: A round shape with every point equidistant from the center.
description.example: The children formed a circle.

C.phrase: New York is a busy [city].

description.definition: A large town or urban area with a large population and many buildings.
description.example: The city never sleeps.

C.phrase: He attended his math [class] today.

description.definition: A group of students who are taught together; a session of teaching.
description.example: The class was interesting.

C.phrase: She is very [clever] at solving puzzles.

description.definition: Quick to understand, learn, and devise or apply ideas; intelligent.
description.example: He is clever with his hands.

C.phrase: She likes to keep her room [clean].

description.definition: Free from dirt, marks, or stains.
description.example: The kitchen is clean.

C.phrase: The water in the lake was [clear].

description.definition: Easy to perceive, understand, or interpret.
description.example: The instructions were clear.

C.phrase: He loves to [climb] mountains.

description.definition: To go or come up a slope, incline, or staircase, especially by using the feet and sometimes the hands.
description.example: She climbed the ladder.

C.phrase: He checked the [clock] to see the time.

description.definition: A device used to measure and indicate time.
description.example: The clock struck midnight.

C.phrase: She used a [cloth] to clean the table.

description.definition: A piece of fabric used for a particular purpose.
description.example: The cloth was soft and absorbent.

C.phrase: She bought new [clothes] for the party.

description.definition: Items worn to cover the body.
description.example: His clothes were neatly ironed.

C.phrase: A big [cloud] covered the sun.

description.definition: A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere.
description.simplified: A mass of vapor in the sky.
description.example: The sky was full of clouds.

C.phrase: The weather was [cloudy] all day.

description.definition: Covered with or characterized by clouds.
description.simplified: With many clouds in the sky.
description.example: It was a cloudy afternoon.

C.phrase: Please [close] the door.

description.definition: To move so that something is no longer open.
description.example: He closed the window.

C.phrase: She drinks [coffee] every morning.

description.definition: A beverage made from roasted coffee beans.
description.simplified: A drink made from coffee beans.
description.example: He ordered a cup of coffee.

C.phrase: She wore a warm [coat] in winter.

description.definition: An outer garment with sleeves, worn outdoors to keep warm or dry.
description.example: His coat was made of wool.

C.phrase: He found a [coin] on the ground.

description.definition: A flat, typically round piece of metal with an official stamp, used as money.
description.example: She put the coin in her pocket.

C.phrase: It was [cold] outside, so he wore a jacket.

description.definition: Having a low temperature, especially when compared to the temperature of the human body.
description.example: The water was very cold.

C.phrase: She likes to [collect] stamps.

description.definition: To gather together from different places or sources.
description.example: He collected old coins.

C.phrase: She painted the walls a bright [colour].

description.definition: The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light.
description.example: The sky turned a beautiful colour at sunset.

C.phrase: She used a [comb] to style her hair.

description.definition: A toothed device used for untangling or arranging hair.
description.example: He found a comb in his pocket.

C.phrase: This chair is really [comfortable].

description.definition: Providing physical ease and relaxation; free from stress or discomfort.
description.example: The bed was so comfortable that I fell asleep quickly.

C.phrase: It's [common] to see people walking in the park.

description.definition: Occurring often; shared by many.
description.example: It's common for birds to migrate in the winter.

C.phrase: Let’s [compare] the two results.

description.definition: To examine the similarities and differences between two or more things.
description.simplified: To look at how things are alike or different.
description.example: You can compare prices before you buy.

C.phrase: Please [come] to the party.

description.definition: To move toward or arrive at a specified place.
description.example: They will come to visit us next week.

C.phrase: Make sure to [complete] the assignment.

description.definition: To finish making or doing something.
description.example: She needs to complete her homework by Friday.

C.phrase: He works on his [computer] every day.

description.definition: An electronic device for storing and processing data.
description.example: I use my computer to browse the internet.

C.phrase: The car is in excellent [condition].

description.definition: The state of something with respect to its appearance, quality, or working order.
description.example: The building is in good condition after renovations.

C.phrase: Please [continue] with your story.

description.definition: To persist in an activity or process without interruption.
description.example: They will continue the meeting after lunch.

C.phrase: He can [control] the lights from his phone.

description.definition: To exercise restraint or direction over; to dominate.
description.example: She has to control her emotions during the presentation.

C.phrase: I love to [cook] new recipes.

description.definition: To prepare food for eating by applying heat.
description.example: He likes to cook dinner for his family.

C.phrase: The breeze felt [cool] on a hot day.

description.definition: Having a moderately low temperature; not warm.
description.example: It's a cool evening, perfect for a walk.

C.phrase: The statue was made of [copper].

description.definition: A reddish-brown metal used for electrical wiring and coins.
description.example: Copper is an excellent conductor of electricity.

C.phrase: She bought fresh [corn] at the market.

description.definition: A cereal plant that yields large grains set in rows on a cob.
description.example: Corn is often eaten on the cob during summer.

C.phrase: Turn right at the next [corner].

description.definition: The point where two lines or surfaces meet.
description.example: There’s a bakery at the corner of the street.

C.phrase: Please [correct] any mistakes in your paper.

description.definition: To make right or accurate; to remove errors.
description.example: She needs to correct her grammar in the essay.

C.phrase: How much does this book [cost]?

description.definition: The amount of money required to purchase something.
description.example: The cost of living is rising in many cities.

C.phrase: The box will [contain] all the items.

description.definition: To hold or include something within.
description.example: The bottle can contain up to one liter of liquid.

C.phrase: Can you [count] how many apples there are?

description.definition: To determine the total number of items in a set.
description.example: She can count to twenty without help.

C.phrase: She traveled to another [country] last year.

description.definition: A nation with its own government and territory.
description.example: France is a country known for its culture and cuisine.

C.phrase: He signed up for a cooking [course].

description.definition: A series of lessons in a particular subject.
description.example: She is taking a course in biology.

C.phrase: Please [cover] the food to keep it warm.

description.definition: To place something over or upon, as to protect or conceal.
description.example: You need to cover the pot while it cooks.

C.phrase: The computer will [crash] if you overload it.

description.definition: To suddenly stop functioning; to break down.
description.example: The car crash caused a traffic jam.

C.phrase: You need to [cross] the street carefully.

description.definition: To move from one side to the other.
description.example: She will cross the river by boat.

C.phrase: The baby began to [cry] loudly.

description.definition: To produce tears as a result of emotion.
description.example: She started to cry when she heard the sad news.

C.phrase: I drank coffee from a [cup].

description.definition: A small, typically cylindrical container used for drinking.
description.example: He filled his cup with water.

C.phrase: She stored the dishes in the [cupboard].

description.definition: A closed space or cabinet with shelves for storing items.
description.example: The cupboard was full of plates and cups.

C.phrase: Be careful when you [cut] the vegetables.

description.definition: To divide something into pieces with a sharp tool.
description.example: He will cut the cake into eight pieces.

D.phrase: She loves to [dance] in the rain.

description.definition: To move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps.
description.example: He learned to dance at an early age.

D.phrase: The mountain trail is very [dangerous] during winter.

description.definition: Able or likely to cause harm or injury.
description.example: Driving in a snowstorm can be dangerous.

D.phrase: The room was completely [dark] when the lights went out.

description.definition: Having little or no light.
description.example: The basement was cold and dark.

D.phrase: Their [daughter] just started college this year.

description.definition: A female child in relation to her parents.
description.example: She has a daughter and a son.

D.phrase: It was a beautiful [day] at the beach.

description.definition: A period of twenty-four hours as a unit of time.
description.example: The event will take place in a few days.

D.phrase: The battery was completely [dead] after the long drive.

description.definition: No longer alive; lifeless.
description.example: The flowers were dead after the frost.

D.phrase: You need to [decide] what you want for dinner.

description.definition: To make a choice or come to a conclusion about something.
description.example: They decided to move to a new city.

D.phrase: The company plans to [decrease] its carbon footprint.

description.definition: To make or become smaller or fewer.
description.example: They decreased the price of the product.

D.phrase: He took a [deep] breath before diving in.

description.definition: Extending far down from the top or surface.
description.example: The water is very deep in this part of the lake.

D.phrase: A group of [deer] crossed the road at dawn.

description.definition: A hoofed grazing or browsing animal, with branched bony antlers that are shed annually.
description.example: We saw a deer in the forest.

D.phrase: We [depend] on our friends during tough times.

description.definition: To rely on or be controlled by someone or something.
description.simplified: To rely on someone or something.
description.example: They depend on each other for support.

D.phrase: Her [desk] was cluttered with papers and books.

description.definition: A piece of furniture with a flat surface used for working, studying, or writing.
description.simplified: A table used for work or study.
description.example: She cleaned her desk before starting work.

D.phrase: The storm managed to [destroy] several homes in the area.

description.definition: To damage something so badly that it no longer exists or works.
description.example: The fire destroyed the entire building.

D.phrase: They want to [develop] a new software application.

description.definition: To grow or cause to grow and become more advanced.
description.example: She developed a new strategy for the company.

D.phrase: Plants will [die] without enough water and sunlight.

description.definition: To stop living; to pass away.
description.example: Many animals die in extreme conditions.

D.phrase: Each culture has [different] traditions and values.

description.definition: Not the same as another or each other.
description.example: They come from different backgrounds.

D.phrase: The exam was more [difficult] than expected.

description.definition: Needing much effort or skill to accomplish.
description.example: This is a difficult task to complete.

D.phrase: We had a lovely [dinner] at the new Italian restaurant.

description.definition: The main meal of the day, usually eaten in the evening.
description.simplified: The main meal of the evening.
description.example: They invited us to dinner on Friday.

D.phrase: He gave me the wrong [direction] to the museum.

description.definition: A course along which someone or something moves.
description.example: She was walking in the wrong direction.

D.phrase: The kids came home with [dirty] clothes after playing outside.

description.definition: Covered or marked with an unclean substance.
description.example: The floor is dirty and needs cleaning.

D.phrase: They hope to [discover] a cure for the disease soon.

description.definition: To find something unexpectedly or during a search.
description.example: Scientists discovered a new species of frog.

D.phrase: My favorite [dish] is homemade lasagna.

description.definition: A particular kind of food prepared as part of a meal.
description.simplified: A type of food prepared as part of a meal.
description.example: She served a delicious pasta dish.

D.phrase: I have so much to [do] today before the meeting.

description.definition: To perform an action, task, or activity.
description.example: I need to do my homework.

D.phrase: Their [dog] loves playing fetch in the park.

description.definition: A domesticated carnivorous mammal typically kept as a pet.
description.example: They have a very friendly dog.

D.phrase: She left the [door] open on her way out.

description.definition: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle.
description.simplified: A movable barrier at an entrance.
description.example: Close the door behind you.

D.phrase: They want to [double] the production by next year.

description.definition: To become twice as much or as many.
description.simplified: To make something twice as much.
description.example: The company plans to double its workforce.

D.phrase: He carefully walked [down] the stairs.

description.definition: Towards or in a lower place or position.
description.example: She looked down from the balcony.

D.phrase: She likes to [draw] portraits in her sketchbook.

description.definition: To produce (a picture or diagram) by making lines and marks.
description.simplified: To create a picture using lines.
description.example: He loves to draw landscapes.

D.phrase: His [dream] is to travel around the world.

description.definition: A series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring in a person's mind during sleep.
description.example: She had a strange dream last night.

D.phrase: She wore a beautiful [dress] to the party.

description.definition: A one-piece garment for a woman or girl that covers the body and extends down over the legs.
description.example: She bought a new dress for the occasion.

D.phrase: Make sure to [drink] plenty of water every day.

description.definition: To take liquid into the mouth and swallow.
description.example: He likes to drink coffee in the morning.

D.phrase: They will [drive] to the countryside this weekend.

description.definition: To operate and control the direction and speed of a vehicle.
description.example: She learned to drive at 16.

D.phrase: Be careful not to [drop] the glass.

description.definition: To let or make something fall vertically.
description.example: He accidentally dropped the keys.

D.phrase: The clothes are still not [dry] after the wash.

description.definition: Free from moisture or liquid; not wet.
description.example: The towel was completely dry.

D.phrase: A [duck] was swimming in the pond near the park.

description.definition: A waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, and webbed feet.
description.simplified: A water bird with webbed feet.
description.example: We fed the duck at the pond.

D.phrase: She needs to [dust] the shelves this weekend.

description.definition: To remove small particles of dirt from a surface.
description.example: He dusted the furniture in the living room.

D.phrase: It is your [duty] to protect the environment.

description.definition: A moral or legal obligation; a responsibility.
description.example: She felt it was her duty to help.

E.phrase: [Each] of the children got a balloon.

description.definition: Every single one of two or more items, considered individually.
description.example: Each student has a book.

description.definition: The organ on the side of the head used for hearing.
description.simplified: Part of the body used to hear.
description.example: She has a small earring in her ear.

E.phrase: We woke up [early] to watch the sunrise.

description.definition: Happening or done before the usual or expected time.
description.example: They arrived early to the party.

E.phrase: He works hard to [earn] a living.

description.definition: To receive money as payment for work that you do.
description.example: She earns a good salary.

description.definition: The planet on which humans live.
description.example: The Earth is round.

description.definition: The direction toward which the sun rises, opposite of west.
description.simplified: The direction where the sun rises.
description.example: Our house faces east.

description.definition: Not difficult; requiring little effort.
description.example: It's easy to make a sandwich.

description.definition: To put food into the mouth, chew it, and swallow it.
description.example: He likes to eat apples.

description.definition: The process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college.
description.example: She values education highly.

E.phrase: The new law will have a big [effect] on businesses.

description.definition: A change that is caused by an action or event.
description.example: The medicine had no side effects.

description.definition: An oval or round object laid by a female bird, fish, or reptile, often used as food.
description.simplified: A food from birds like chickens.
description.example: I had a boiled egg for lunch.

E.phrase: There are [eight] apples in the basket.

description.definition: The number following seven and before nine.
description.example: She is eight years old.

description.definition: Used to indicate a choice between two possibilities.
description.example: You can have either tea or coffee.

description.definition: Powered by electricity.
description.example: The lamp is electric.

description.definition: A large mammal with a trunk, native to Africa and Asia.
description.simplified: A big animal with a trunk.
description.example: The elephant is the largest land animal.

description.definition: In addition; besides.
description.example: There is nothing else to do.

description.definition: Containing nothing; not filled.
description.example: The room was empty.

description.definition: To bring to a conclusion or close.
description.example: The show ends at 10 p.m.

description.definition: A person who is actively opposed or hostile to someone or something.
description.example: They became enemies after the fight.

description.definition: To take pleasure in something.
description.example: She enjoys reading books.

E.phrase: He didn't have [enough] money to buy it.

description.definition: As much as is necessary; sufficient.
description.example: Do we have enough chairs?

description.definition: To go or come into a place.
description.example: She entered the room slowly.

E.phrase: All people should be treated as [equal].

description.definition: Being the same in quantity, size, degree, or value.
description.simplified: The same in amount or value.
description.example: They split the prize into equal parts.

E.phrase: The [entrance] to the building was locked.

description.definition: A place where you enter, or the act of entering.
description.example: They stood near the entrance.

description.definition: To break free from confinement or control.
description.example: The cat escaped from the house.

E.phrase: He was calm, [even] in a crisis.

description.definition: Used to emphasize something surprising or extreme.
description.example: Even she was surprised.

E.phrase: We went for a walk in the [evening].

description.definition: The part of the day between the afternoon and night.
description.simplified: The time between afternoon and night.
description.example: They met in the evening.

E.phrase: The concert was the main [event] of the night.

description.definition: A planned public or social occasion.
description.example: The event was well-attended.

description.definition: At any time.
description.simplified: At any time in the past or future.
description.example: She hardly ever eats meat.

description.definition: Including each one of a group without exception.
description.example: Every student must attend.

description.definition: All the people.
description.example: Everyone is invited.

E.phrase: She gave the [exact] number of candies.

description.definition: Completely correct in every detail.
description.example: The exact time is 3:15 p.m.

description.definition: Every person.
description.example: Everybody is welcome here.

description.definition: A formal test of a person's knowledge or skills in a particular area.
description.simplified: A test of knowledge or skills.
description.example: He passed the examination easily.

E.phrase: She gave an [example] to explain her point.

description.definition: A thing characteristic of its kind or illustrating a general rule.
description.simplified: A specific case to show something.
description.example: For example, look at this diagram.

E.phrase: Everyone came to the party [except] John.

description.definition: Not including; other than.
description.example: He eats everything except meat.

E.phrase: The children were [excited] about the trip.

description.definition: Feeling or showing enthusiasm or eagerness.
description.example: She was excited to see her friend.

description.definition: Physical activity that you do to make your body strong and healthy.
description.simplified: Activity to keep fit and healthy.
description.example: Daily exercise is good for you.

description.definition: To think that something will happen.
description.example: I expect it will rain tomorrow.

E.phrase: The car was too [expensive] for him to buy.

description.definition: Costing a lot of money.
description.example: That dress is very expensive.

E.phrase: She tried to [explain] the rules to him.

description.definition: To make something clear or easy to understand by describing it in more detail.
description.example: Can you explain how this works?

description.definition: To a very great degree; very.
description.example: She was extremely happy.

description.definition: The organ that enables sight.
description.simplified: The part of the body that sees.
description.example: Close your eyes and rest.

F.phrase: She smiled when she saw his [face].

description.definition: The front part of a person's head, from the forehead to the chin.
description.simplified: The front part of the head.
description.example: Her face lit up when she got the news.

F.phrase: It's a [fact] that the Earth revolves around the Sun.

description.definition: A thing that is known or proved to be true.
description.example: The fact is, she was right.

F.phrase: He didn't want to [fail] the test.

description.definition: To be unsuccessful in achieving one's goal.
description.example: She failed to complete the project on time.

F.phrase: The leaves begin to [fall] in autumn.

description.definition: To move downward, typically rapidly and freely without control.
description.example: He slipped and fell on the ice.

description.definition: Not according with truth or fact; incorrect.
description.example: The rumor turned out to be false.

F.phrase: I spent the weekend with my [family].

description.definition: A group consisting of parents and children living together in a household.
description.simplified: People related by blood or marriage.
description.example: Family gatherings are a tradition.

description.definition: Known about by many people.
description.example: The famous actor visited our town.

description.definition: At, to, or by a great distance.
description.example: The mountains are far from here.

F.phrase: They own a large [farm] in the countryside.

description.definition: An area of land and its buildings used for growing crops and raising animals.
description.simplified: Land for growing crops or raising animals.
description.example: The farm produces vegetables and dairy products.

F.phrase: Her [father] taught her how to ride a bike.

description.definition: A male parent.
description.example: Her father works at the hospital.

description.definition: At high speed.
description.example: He runs very fast.

F.phrase: The cat is [fat] because it eats a lot.

description.definition: Having a large amount of excess flesh.
description.example: The fat dog sat lazily in the yard.

F.phrase: It was not her [fault] that the vase broke.

description.definition: Responsibility for an accident or misfortune.
description.example: It’s my fault that we missed the bus.

description.definition: An unpleasant emotion caused by the threat of danger, pain, or harm.
description.example: She was paralyzed by fear during the storm.

description.definition: To give food to someone or something.
description.example: The farmer feeds the animals every morning.

description.definition: To experience an emotion or sensation.
description.simplified: To sense or experience something emotionally or physically.
description.example: He feels cold in the winter.

description.definition: Of or denoting the sex that can bear offspring or produce eggs.
description.example: The female athlete won the race.

F.phrase: She has a high [fever] and should see a doctor.

description.definition: An abnormally high body temperature, usually as a result of illness.
description.simplified: High body temperature due to illness.
description.example: The child’s fever lasted for three days.

F.phrase: Only a [few] people came to the meeting.

description.definition: A small number of.
description.example: There are only a few apples left.

F.phrase: The two boys started to [fight] over the toy.

description.definition: To take part in a violent struggle involving physical force.
description.example: They fight for their rights.

description.definition: To make something full.
description.simplified: To put something into a container until it is full.
description.example: He filled the bucket with sand.

description.definition: A movie or motion picture.
description.example: The film was about a superhero.

description.definition: To discover or locate something.
description.simplified: To search for and locate something.
description.example: She found her lost ring under the bed.

description.definition: Of high quality or satisfactory.
description.example: Everything is going to be fine.

description.definition: Each of the five digits at the end of a person's hand.
description.simplified: A part of the hand used for touching and holding.
description.example: He pointed with his index finger.

description.definition: To bring something to an end.
description.example: He finished the race in first place.

S.phrase: She felt [sad] when her cat ran away.

description.definition: Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.
description.example: He was sad after hearing the bad news.

S.phrase: Make sure to keep your money [safe].

description.definition: Protected from or not exposed to danger or risk.
description.example: The children were safe at home.

S.phrase: They decided to [sail] across the ocean.

description.definition: To travel on water in a ship or boat using sails.
description.simplified: To travel on a boat powered by the wind.
description.example: They sailed the boat to a nearby island.

S.phrase: Please pass the [salt] for the fries.

description.definition: A white crystalline substance used to season or preserve food.
description.simplified: A substance used to add flavor to food.
description.example: She added salt to the soup.

S.phrase: They wore the [same] dress to the party.

description.definition: Identical; not different.
description.example: We have the same shoes.

S.phrase: The beach was covered in soft [sand].

description.definition: A loose granular substance found on beaches, deserts, and riverbeds, made of small particles of rock and minerals.
description.simplified: Tiny grains of rock, usually found on beaches.
description.example: The children played in the sand by the shore.

S.phrase: She decided to [save] some money for a vacation.

description.definition: To keep something for future use; to avoid waste or loss.
description.simplified: To keep something to use later.
description.example: He saved some money for his new car.

S.phrase: What did she [say] to you?

description.definition: To speak words aloud.
description.example: He said he would be home soon.

S.phrase: The children go to [school] every weekday.

description.definition: An institution where children and young people are educated.
description.simplified: A place where people go to learn.
description.example: She attends a public school.

S.phrase: He loves studying [science] in college.

description.definition: The systematic study of the structure and behavior of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment.
description.simplified: The study of the natural world through experiments.
description.example: She enjoys science because she likes learning about nature.

S.phrase: She used [scissors] to cut the paper.

description.definition: A tool used for cutting materials like paper, cloth, or hair, typically consisting of two blades.
description.simplified: A tool used for cutting, with two sharp blades.
description.example: The teacher handed out scissors for the art project.

S.phrase: They began to [search] for the missing keys.

description.definition: To try to find something by looking or otherwise seeking carefully and thoroughly.
description.simplified: To look for something you can't find.
description.example: He searched the house for his lost wallet.

S.phrase: Please take a [seat].

description.definition: A thing made or used for sitting on, such as a chair or bench.
description.simplified: Something you sit on, like a chair.
description.example: The airplane had comfortable seats.

S.phrase: She finished in [second] place in the race.

description.definition: Coming after the first in time or order; ranking.
description.simplified: Next in line after the first.
description.example: He won a silver medal for second place.

S.phrase: Can you [see] the mountains from here?

description.definition: To perceive with the eyes; to look at or notice something.
description.simplified: To look at something with your eyes.
description.example: She can see the stars at night.

S.phrase: It doesn't [seem] like a good idea.

description.definition: To give the impression of being or doing something.
description.simplified: To appear or look like something is a certain way.
description.example: He seems tired today.

S.phrase: They decided to [sell] their car.

description.definition: To give or hand over something in exchange for money.
description.example: She sold her old phone online.

S.phrase: I will [send] you the documents tomorrow.

description.definition: To cause something to go or be taken to a particular destination.
description.example: She sent the letter by mail.

S.phrase: Can you form a [sentence] using this word?

description.definition: A set of words that is complete in itself, typically containing a subject and predicate.
description.simplified: A group of words that forms a complete thought.
description.example: Write a sentence for your homework.

S.phrase: The waiter will [serve] the food shortly.

description.definition: To present food or drink to someone.
description.simplified: To give food or help to someone.
description.example: She served dinner to the guests.

S.phrase: She has [seven] cats at home.

description.definition: The number equivalent to the sum of three and four; one more than six.
description.example: There are seven days in a week.

S.phrase: She invited [several] friends to the party.

description.definition: More than two but not many.
description.simplified: More than a few, but not many.
description.example: They had several options to choose from.

S.phrase: The study examined the difference between male and female [sex].

description.definition: The state of being male or female.
description.example: The doctor asked for his sex on the form.

S.phrase: They sat under the [shade] of the tree.

description.definition: A shadow or area sheltered from sunlight.
description.simplified: A place out of direct sunlight.
description.example: We found some shade under the umbrella.

S.phrase: The tree cast a long [shadow] on the ground.

description.definition: A dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface.
description.simplified: A dark shape made when something blocks the light.
description.example: He saw his own shadow as he walked.

S.phrase: Please [shake] the bottle before using it.

description.definition: To move an object or your body up and down or from side to side with quick, short movements.
description.simplified: To move something quickly back and forth.
description.example: He shook the soda can.

S.phrase: The toy has a square [shape].

description.definition: The external form or appearance of something.
description.simplified: The form or outline of something.
description.example: He noticed the shape of the moon.

S.phrase: They [share] their food with each other.

description.definition: To have a portion of something with others.
description.simplified: To give a part of what you have to others.
description.example: She shared her snacks with her friends.

S.phrase: Be careful, the knife is very [sharp].

description.definition: Having an edge or point that is able to cut or pierce something.
description.simplified: Having a very thin edge that can cut.
description.example: The scissors are sharp enough to cut paper.

S.phrase: [She] is going to the market today.

description.definition: Used to refer to a female person or animal.
description.simplified: A word for a girl or woman.
description.example: She is my best friend.

S.phrase: The farmer owns a flock of [sheep].

description.definition: A domesticated animal with a thick woolly coat, kept for its wool or meat.
description.simplified: A farm animal that has wool.
description.example: The sheep grazed in the field.

S.phrase: She pulled the [sheet] over her bed.

description.definition: A large rectangular piece of fabric used to cover a bed.
description.simplified: A large piece of cloth for a bed.
description.example: I put clean sheets on the bed.

S.phrase: He placed the books on the top [shelf].

description.definition: A flat, horizontal surface used for storing or displaying objects.
description.simplified: A flat surface on a wall or furniture for holding things.
description.example: The shelf is full of books.

S.phrase: The sun began to [shine] brightly in the sky.

description.definition: To emit or reflect light.
description.simplified: To give off or reflect light.
description.example: The flashlight shines in the dark.

S.phrase: The [ship] sailed across the ocean.

description.definition: A large boat used for traveling across the sea.
description.simplified: A big boat that travels on the sea.
description.example: The ship reached the shore after a long journey.

S.phrase: He wore a white [shirt] to the meeting.

description.definition: A garment for the upper body, typically with a collar and sleeves.
description.simplified: A piece of clothing worn on the top part of the body.
description.example: I need to iron my shirt before work.

S.phrase: He put on his favorite [shoe] before leaving.

description.definition: A covering for the foot, typically made of leather or rubber.
description.simplified: A piece of clothing worn on the feet.
description.example: He wore brown shoes to the event.

S.phrase: He aimed the ball and [shot] it into the goal.

description.definition: To fire a projectile or direct a ball toward a target.
description.simplified: To send something flying towards a target.
description.example: He shoots the basketball toward the hoop.

S.phrase: They went to the [shop] to buy groceries.

description.definition: A place where goods or services are sold.
description.simplified: A place where you buy things.
description.example: The shop was filled with fresh fruits and vegetables.

S.phrase: He wore [short] pants during summer.

description.definition: Measuring a small distance from one end to the other.
description.simplified: Not long in length or time.
description.example: The movie was shorter than I expected.

S.phrase: You [should] always be polite to others.

description.definition: Used to indicate obligation, duty, or correctness.
description.simplified: Used to say what is the right or expected thing to do.
description.example: She should call her friend tomorrow.

S.phrase: He injured his [shoulder] during the game.

description.definition: The part of the body between the neck and the upper arm.
description.simplified: The part of the body that connects the arm to the body.
description.example: She felt pain in her shoulder after lifting the box.

S.phrase: He had to [shout] to be heard over the noise.

description.definition: To speak or cry out loudly and forcefully.
description.example: She shouted to get her friend's attention.

S.phrase: He will [show] us the way to the station.

description.definition: To cause or allow something to be seen.
description.example: He showed her how to solve the math problem.

S.phrase: She felt [sick] after eating too much candy.

description.definition: Affected by physical or mental illness.
description.example: He was too sick to go to school.

S.phrase: He stood by the [side] of the road.

description.definition: A position to the left or right of an object, place, or central point.
description.simplified: The edge or area next to something.
description.example: They placed the table to the side of the room.

S.phrase: It was raining, [so] we stayed inside.

description.definition: Used to indicate the effect or result of something.
description.simplified: Used to show a result of something.
description.example: He was tired, so he went to bed early.

S.phrase: Please wash your hands with [soap].

description.definition: A substance used for washing and cleaning, usually made from fats and oils.
description.simplified: A substance used to clean things, especially your body.
description.example: He used soap to clean the dishes.

S.phrase: He put on a clean [sock] before wearing his shoes.

description.definition: A piece of clothing worn on the foot inside a shoe.
description.simplified: A cloth item worn on your foot inside a shoe.
description.example: She bought a new pair of socks.

S.phrase: The pillow was very [soft] and comfortable.

description.definition: Easy to press, bend, or shape; not hard or firm.
description.simplified: Not hard and easy to touch.
description.example: The baby’s skin feels soft.

S.phrase: She ate [some] of the cake.

description.definition: An unspecified amount or number of something.
description.simplified: A small or certain amount of something.
description.example: I need some help with my homework.

S.phrase: [Someone] left their umbrella in the hall.

description.definition: An unknown or unspecified person.
description.simplified: A person you do not know or name.
description.example: Someone knocked on the door.

S.phrase: [Something] smells good in the kitchen.

description.definition: An object, event, or situation that is not exactly known or specified.
description.simplified: A thing that you don't exactly know.
description.example: I think I left something in the car.

S.phrase: [Sometimes] we go to the park on weekends.

description.definition: Occasionally, rather than all the time.
description.simplified: At certain times, but not always.
description.example: He sometimes skips breakfast.

S.phrase: Their [son] is studying at the university.

description.definition: A male child in relation to his parents.
description.simplified: A boy or man in relation to his parents.
description.example: They are proud of their son’s achievements.

S.phrase: We will be leaving [soon].

description.definition: In a short time, or before long.
description.simplified: In a little while; not long from now.
description.example: She will arrive soon.

S.phrase: I am [sorry] for being late.

description.definition: Feeling regret, sadness, or remorse for something.
description.simplified: Feeling bad about something you did.
description.example: He was sorry for hurting her feelings.

S.phrase: The [sound] of the rain was soothing.

description.definition: Vibrations that travel through the air and can be heard when they reach the ear.
description.example: The sound of birds singing woke me up.

S.phrase: She made a warm bowl of [soup] for dinner.

description.definition: A liquid dish made by boiling meat, vegetables, or fish in water.
description.simplified: A warm liquid food often made with vegetables or meat.
description.example: I had chicken soup for lunch.

S.phrase: They traveled [south] for the winter.

description.definition: The direction toward the point of the horizon 90 degrees to the right of east.
description.example: Birds fly south in the winter.

S.phrase: There’s enough [space] for everyone to sit down.

description.definition: A continuous area or expanse that is free, available, or unoccupied.
description.example: We found a parking space near the store.

S.phrase: He will [speak] at the conference next week.

description.definition: To say words; to talk.
description.simplified: To talk to someone or say something.
description.example: She speaks three languages.

S.phrase: This necklace is [special] to me because it was a gift.

description.definition: Better, greater, or otherwise different from what is usual.
description.simplified: Unique or important in some way.
description.example: The day was special for everyone.

S.phrase: The car’s [speed] was too fast for the narrow road.

description.definition: The rate at which someone or something moves or operates.
description.example: The speed limit is 50 kilometers per hour.

S.phrase: Can you [spell] your name for me, please?

description.definition: To name or write the letters that form a word in the correct order.
description.simplified: To say or write the letters of a word in order.
description.example: He spelled his last name for the clerk.

S.phrase: They [spend] time together every weekend.

description.definition: To use time doing something or pass it in a particular manner.
description.example: We spent the afternoon at the park.

S.phrase: She stirred the soup with a [spoon].

description.definition: A utensil consisting of a small, shallow bowl with a handle, used for eating or serving food.
description.simplified: A tool with a round end used for eating or stirring.
description.example: He ate cereal with a spoon.

S.phrase: She plays her favorite [sport] on the weekends.

description.definition: An activity involving physical exertion and skill in which an individual or team competes against another or others.
description.simplified: A physical activity done for enjoyment or competition.
description.example: Football is a popular sport worldwide.

S.phrase: He used a knife to [spread] butter on his toast.

description.definition: To extend over a large or increasing area.
description.simplified: To apply or stretch something over a surface.
description.example: She spread the blanket on the grass.

S.phrase: [Spring] is my favorite season because of the blooming flowers.

description.definition: The season between winter and summer when the weather becomes warmer and plants start to grow again.
description.simplified: The season after winter when plants grow and the weather gets warmer.
description.example: We went for a picnic in spring.

S.phrase: They met at the town [square].

description.definition: A plane figure with four equal straight sides and four right angles, or a public open area where people can meet.
description.simplified: A shape with four equal sides, or a public meeting place.
description.example: The park is in the center of the square.

S.phrase: He put a [stamp] on the envelope before sending it.

description.definition: A small piece of paper stuck on mail to show that the cost of sending it has been paid.
description.simplified: A small piece of paper that shows payment for sending mail.
description.example: She collected rare stamps.

S.phrase: Please [stand] up when your name is called.

description.definition: To be in an upright position on the feet.
description.simplified: To rise and be on your feet.
description.example: They stood to show respect during the ceremony.

S.phrase: The night sky was full of [stars].

description.definition: A fixed luminous point in the night sky, which is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun.
description.simplified: A bright point in the sky seen at night.
description.example: We made wishes on the shooting stars.

S.phrase: The race will [start] in five minutes.

description.definition: To begin or set in motion.
description.example: They started their journey early in the morning.

S.phrase: We waited for the train at the [station].

description.definition: A place where buses, trains, or other vehicles regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off.
description.simplified: A place where trains or buses stop for passengers.
description.example: The bus station is near my house.

S.phrase: We decided to [stay] home because it was raining.

description.definition: To remain in a specific place or position.
description.example: She stayed at her friend's house last night.

S.phrase: Someone tried to [steal] my wallet.

description.definition: To take something that does not belong to you, without permission.
description.simplified: To take something that isn't yours.
description.example: He was caught trying to steal a bike.

S.phrase: The hot soup was giving off [steam].

description.definition: The vapor into which water is converted when heated, forming a white mist of minute water droplets.
description.simplified: The mist that comes from boiling water.
description.example: The steam from the kettle filled the room.

S.phrase: She took a [step] forward to get a better view.

description.definition: The act of lifting one foot and putting it down in a new position.
description.simplified: One movement made by lifting your foot and moving it.
description.example: He took a few steps back.

S.phrase: Please remain [still] while I take the photo.

description.definition: Not moving or making a sound.
description.example: The water was completely still, without a ripple.

S.phrase: He complained of a [stomach] ache after eating too much.

description.definition: The internal organ in which the major part of the digestion of food occurs.
description.simplified: The part of your body where food is digested.
description.example: His stomach hurt after the meal.

S.phrase: She picked up a smooth [stone] from the beach.

description.definition: A hard, solid nonmetallic mineral matter of which rock is made.
description.example: They skipped stones across the lake.

S.phrase: The car will [stop] at the traffic light.

description.definition: To come to an end; cease to happen.
description.simplified: To bring something to an end or not move.
description.example: He stopped walking to take a rest.

S.phrase: We went to the [store] to buy groceries.

description.definition: A place where goods are sold to customers.
description.simplified: A shop where you can buy things.
description.example: She works at a clothing store.

S.phrase: The [storm] caused heavy rainfall and strong winds.

description.definition: A violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow.
description.simplified: Very bad weather with wind and rain or snow.
description.example: The storm lasted all night.

S.phrase: She read a bedtime [story] to the children.

description.definition: An account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment.
description.simplified: A tale or account of events, either real or fictional.
description.example: He wrote a short story about his childhood.

S.phrase: She heard a [strange] noise coming from the attic.

description.definition: Unusual or surprising in a way that is unsettling or hard to understand.
description.example: He felt strange after eating something unfamiliar.

S.phrase: They live on a quiet [street] in the suburbs.

description.definition: A public road in a city or town, typically with houses and buildings on one or both sides.
description.simplified: A road in a town or city where people and vehicles travel.
description.example: Cars lined the street on both sides.

S.phrase: He is physically [strong] and can lift heavy weights.

description.definition: Having great physical power and ability to move heavy things or exert force.
description.simplified: Able to use a lot of force; powerful.
description.example: The strong wind knocked down the trees.

S.phrase: The [structure] of the building was damaged during the earthquake.

description.definition: The arrangement of and relations between the parts or elements of something complex.
description.simplified: The way parts of something are organized or put together.
description.example: The bridge has a solid structure.

S.phrase: The [student] asked a question during the lecture.

description.definition: A person who is studying at a school or college.
description.simplified: A person who is learning at school or college.
description.example: The student studied hard for the exam.

S.phrase: She needs to [study] for her final exams.

description.definition: To apply oneself to acquiring knowledge, typically by reading.
description.simplified: To learn about something, especially by reading.
description.example: He studied late into the night.

S.phrase: He made a [stupid] mistake during the test.

description.definition: Having or showing a great lack of intelligence or common sense.
description.example: That was a stupid thing to do.

S.phrase: History was her favorite [subject] in school.

description.definition: A branch of knowledge studied or taught in school, college, or university.
description.simplified: A field of study or area of knowledge.
description.example: Mathematics is a challenging subject.

S.phrase: The scientist discovered a new chemical [substance].

description.definition: A particular kind of matter with uniform properties.
description.simplified: A type of material or matter.
description.example: Water is a simple substance.

S.phrase: She is a [successful] businesswoman with many clients.

description.definition: Achieving or having achieved success.
description.simplified: Having achieved what you aimed for.
description.example: He became a successful writer.

S.phrase: [Such] behavior will not be tolerated in the classroom.

description.definition: Of the type previously mentioned or implied.
description.example: She had never seen such a beautiful painting.

S.phrase: There was a [sudden] change in the weather.

description.definition: Occurring or done quickly and unexpectedly or without warning.
description.example: His sudden arrival surprised everyone.

S.phrase: She added a teaspoon of [sugar] to her tea.

description.definition: A sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, used as a sweetener in food and drink.
description.simplified: A sweet substance used in food and drinks.
description.example: The cake needs more sugar.

S.phrase: The shoes were not [suitable] for hiking.

description.definition: Right or appropriate for a particular person, purpose, or situation.
description.simplified: Appropriate or fitting for a situation.
description.example: These clothes are suitable for cold weather.

S.phrase: [Summer] is my favorite season because of the warm weather.

description.definition: The warmest season of the year, typically between spring and autumn.
description.simplified: The hot season between spring and autumn.
description.example: We always go to the beach in summer.

S.phrase: The [sun] was shining brightly in the sky.

description.definition: The star around which the earth orbits and from which it receives heat and light.
description.simplified: The star that gives light and heat to Earth.
description.example: The sun rises in the east.

S.phrase: It was a beautiful, [sunny] day at the beach.

description.definition: Bright with sunlight.
description.example: The weather forecast says it will be sunny tomorrow.

S.phrase: Her family gave her emotional [support] during a difficult time.

description.definition: Assistance, encouragement, or approval provided to someone or something.
description.example: She received a lot of support from her friends.

S.phrase: Are you [sure] this is the right way?

description.definition: Confident that one is correct.
description.example: I’m sure I locked the door.

S.phrase: They planned a [surprise] party for her birthday.

description.definition: An unexpected or astonishing event, fact, or thing.
description.example: The gift was a pleasant surprise.

S.phrase: The cake was too [sweet] for my taste.

description.definition: Having the pleasant taste characteristic of sugar or honey.
description.example: I prefer sweet foods to salty ones.

S.phrase: They went for a [swim] in the lake.

description.definition: To move through water by making movements with your arms and legs.
description.simplified: To move through water using your body.
description.example: She learned how to swim when she was five.

S.phrase: The knight drew his [sword] before the battle.

description.definition: A weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt, used for fighting.
description.simplified: A long blade used in combat.
description.example: The museum had ancient swords on display.
